amendment.description: An amendment numbered twenty-two printed in the Congressional Record to provide $200 million for additional expenses, not otherwise provided for, that are related to the procurement, installation or operation of radiation portal monitoring technology.

action.text: Mr. Rogers (KY) raised a point of order against the Turner (TX) amendment (A021). Mr. Rogers (KY) stated that the amendment constitutes legislation in an appropriations bill and was not in order under clause 2 of rule 21. The Chair sustained the point of order.
House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A021) offered by Mr. Turner (TX).
